name: Hotel Room 302 - The Rear Window Suite
description: The room's defining feature is an enormous window that overlooks the courtyard and neighboring building with alarming clarity. A telescope stands on a tripod by the window, ostensibly for stargazing but positioned at an angle that suggests more terrestrial interests. The walls are covered in framed black-and-white photographs of city scenes, windows, and people in candid moments. A leather armchair faces the window, worn in the seat from long sessions of sitting and... observing. The desk drawer contains a pair of binoculars and a notebook filled with detailed notes about bird migration patterns, which is definitely what they're for.

features.window: Floor to ceiling glass providing an unobstructed view of several dozen other windows. Some have curtains. Some don't. The telescope is probably for astronomy.
features.telescope: A serious piece of optical equipment pointed at a suspiciously convenient angle. The lens cap is gathering dust, suggesting frequent use.
features.armchair: Leather worn smooth in the seat, positioned for optimal window viewing. The side table holds coffee rings and what might be surveillance schedulesâ€”bird watching schedules.
features.notebook: Detailed observations about flight patterns, nesting behaviors, and 'the one with the red tie who waters plants at 6 PM.' Very detailed bird behaviors.
